title: Strange Strength
description: The previous Strange website was in desperate need of a refresh. I was charged with building a streamlined site that would excite potential members and help current members keep updated about gym schedules and events.

title: Sh*t To Do With Kids
description:
Sh*t To Do With Kids is a project I embarked on with a friend and fellow dad. 
 
 Lacking easy-to-access resources for great activities to do with our kids on the weekends, we created a hyper-local newsletter to allow parents to find at least 5 things to do in their LA neighborhood. 

  I tackled the design and coding of both the landing page and the email newsletter template, and the coding of the backend, utilizing Python scripts and the OpenAI API to turn the spreadsheet of events we found into both social posts to be auto-scheduled throughout the week, as well as newsletters for 5+ neighborhoods in LA via the ConvertKit API.
 
 Coding email newsletters are infamously tricky because of the different ways that email clients render HTML.  Not to mention our chosen email service, ConvertKit, has their own idiosyncrasies.  I'm proud of the result, and it's been a lot of fun to watch the newsletter grow in subscribers.

title: Aqualand of the Free
description: E-commerce website development for Aqualand of the Free, featuring a custom shopping experience.

title: Legion of Fun
description: Legion of Fun is a e-commerce outfit revolutionizing the foam surfboard market for kids and teens.  We integrated board designs and their fun primary colors into the website, as well as focusing on lifestyle visuals to complete the look and feel of the site.  We built into the Shopify ecosystem so that Legion of Fun can continue to grow in the available distribution and sales channels without rebuilding or starting over.
